required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevention of Pacemaker Lead Induced Tricuspid regurgitAtion by Transesophageal eCho guidEd Implantation Registry
clinical_study.official_title: Prevention of Pacemaker Lead Induced Tricuspid regurgitAtion by Transesophageal eCho guidEd Implantation Registry

brief_summary.textblock: Registry for patients undergoing pacemaker/ICD implantation including a transtricuspid lead with and without intraprocedural transesophageal echocardiography to evaluate risk factors for lead induced tricuspid regurgitation.

detailed_description.textblock:
Lead induced tricuspid regurgitation is a common finding after pacemaker/ICD Implantation. Transesophageal echocardiography (TEE) might be used to guide lead implantations in order to prevent tricuspid regurgitation.
In this registry, patients undergoing pacemaker/ICD implantation including a transtricuspid lead are enrolled. While in most patients lead implantation is guided by fluroscopy, in some patients lead implantation is guided by TEE in addition to fluroscopy.
Aims of this registry: Evaluation of
- Incidence of lead induced tricuspid regurgitation
- Mortality and morbidity of lead induced tricuspid regurgitation
- Identification of risk factors for lead induced tricuspid regurgitation
- Influence of the lead position within the tricuspid valve on the incidence of lead induced tricuspid regurgitation
- Prevention of lead induced tricuspid regurgitation by TEE-guided lead implantation

primary_outcome.measure: Increase of tricuspid regurgitation by at least one grade (on a scale from 0-4)
primary_outcome.description: Lead induced tricuspid regurgitation measured by transthoracic echocardiography

secondary_outcome.description: Dose-are product applied during lead implantation
Incidence of acute lead revisions within 30 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Increase of tricuspid regurgitation by at least one grade (on a scale from 0-4)
secondary_outcome.description: Lead induced tricuspid regurgitation measured by transthoracic echocardiography

secondary_outcome.measure: Increase of tricuspid regurgitation by at least one grade (on a scale from 0-4)
secondary_outcome.description: Lead induced tricuspid regurgitation measured by transthoracic echocardiography

arm_group.description: All patients undergoing pacemaker/CRT implantation with concomitant transesophageal echocardiography in addition to fluoroscopic guidance
All patients undergoing standard pacemaker/CRT implantation guided by fluoroscopy only (retrospective historical control group)

intervention.description: In patients undergoing lead implantation including transesophageal echocardiography for clinical reasons (e.g. intraprocedural cardioversion), echocardiography was also used for guidance of lead implantation to reduce lead-leaflet interactions

study_pop.textblock: All adult patients undergoing pacemaker/ICD implantation including a transtricuspid lead were included in this registry.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- indication for pacemaker/ICD implantation including a transtricuspid lead according to guidelines
Exclusion Criteria:
- pre-existing RV lead
- pre-existing TR >2
